lead_paragraph: A downward trend had been indicated for years, but a national count made it official. The population total in 2015 was lower, by almost a million, than that of the census in 2010.

headline.print_headline: Japan Lost Nearly a Million People in 5 Years, Census Says
headline.main: Japan Lost Nearly a Million People in 5 Years, Census Says

snippet: A downward trend had been indicated for years, but a national count made it official. The population total in 2015 was lower, by almost a million, than that of the census in 2010.
abstract: Census figures reveal Japan's population declined by nearly a million people over half-decade, unprecedented drop that provides partial explanation for country's economic woes; some say problem is not falling population but outsize percentage of elderly.
